tweets.text: @kennedymwavu @rstats_tweets Finally, we name the output columns in the `.names` argument: "res{x_idx}", where {x_idx} is the index number of our four element vector c(2018:2012).

Today is World Health Day so I mapped how much money people spend per capita on medical goods & services in 2019

As far as I can see, the normal use of the #rtweet package to get tweets in the usual rates of 3000 tweets max. is not possible anymore without a developer account. This is the end of using #rtweet in academic teaching.
@gdequeiroz @rstats_tweets I use ‚Äú%>%‚Äù if it‚Äôs an introductory course with the tidyverse.

The grouped_ggbetweenstats produce actually several plots that are combined together,which is not what I am looking for. I want something similar to #ggpubr, but with the nice statistical details from #ggstatsplot. Any ideas?
#rstats @patilindrajeets #DataVisualization #ggplot2 https://t.co/Z0LzgT4x4m https://t.co/hKs48rYCev
Would it be possible to make a nice grouped boxplot ( 2 categorical variables and 1 continues variable) in R with p values and median values just like the beautiful plots produced in #ggstatsplot ?

If I'm teaching R (and, of course, tidyverse) ... 

should I use "|>" or "%>%"? 

#rstats #rladies https://t.co/SCIHNOzS0q

I N D O N E S I A
#rayshader, #rstats #population #rstudio https://t.co/A37znD6ZXP

I've got a new video that will surely be completely uncontroversial, on the pros and cons of different tools/languages for doing applied econometrics in.

Featuring for the first time on my channel an extremely-YouTube-style intentional thumbnail! https://t.co/v51wELMEYe

urls.title: What Language Should You Use for Econometrics?
urls.description: There are plenty of tools and languages you can use these days for doing econometrics in. What are they, and what are they good for (or not good for)? In thi...

tweets.text: @CavaliereGiu @grant_mcdermott @uoregon Looks good but why R?  Python has, by far, the largest network externality for data science.  I am a Matlab veteran and slowly making the transition. In addition, the tensor flow-keras library developed by Google for Python make neural network "training" much faster and easier.

As always, I used @coolors_co  beautiful pallets. The rounded flag icons were downloaded from @flaticon . Data retrieved from @OurWorldInData and made by the @worldbankdata team. 
Thanks! Thanks! Thanks!

tweets.text:
Tonight is 'back to the basics' time on the 'Open Online R Stream'. If you are just starting out with R (or just want to get a refresher on some basic concepts), feel free to tune in at 6pm (CEST). More details here: https://t.co/Hwl8cmYSuw

#RStats #statistics

urls.title: Live Streams [Wolfgang Viechtbauer]
urls.description: Due to the coronavirus pandemic (which has led many to explore the possibilities and potential of online teaching), I started to run the occasional live stream via the stream ing platform Twitch where I talk about R, statistics, and whatever else comes up. Given the overall positive reaction to this, I plan on doing more teaching in this manner in the future. Below, you can find information on upcoming live streams, how to join/participate, and what topics have been covered in the past (including all the
